required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Defocused Shock Wave Therapy for Chronic Wounds
clinical_study.official_title: Defocused Shock Wave Therapy for Chronic Soft Tissue Wounds of the Lower Limbs. A Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock:
Chronic soft tissue wounds of the lower limbs are painful and debilitating condition that significantly reduce the quality of life of the patient. They often do not respond to conservative treatments or advanced wound managements. Focused and defocused extracorporeal shock wave therapy can be a viable alternative therapeutic strategy.
The purpose of the study was to examine the effects of defocused extracorporeal shock wave treatment on chronic soft tissue wounds of the lower limbs, in terms of the rate of wound healing and pain control.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline of the wound surface
primary_outcome.time_frame: 15 days, 1 month and 3 months after treatment
primary_outcome.description: Computerized digital photo documentation was used to define the size of the wound with a specific software

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline of the wound characteristic
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 15 days, 1 month and 3 months after treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Wounds characteristics were assessed by the Bates-Jensen Wound Assessment Tool

secondary_outcome.measure: Improvement in subjective wound-related pain intensity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 15 days, 1 month and 3 months after treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Subjective wound-related pain was evaluated using the Visual Analogue Score

arm_group.description: Defocused shock waves were provided by an electromagnetic generator (DUOLITH® SD1 - Storz Medical AG, Tägerwilen, Switzerland). The protocol consisted of a series of 3 sessions in 2 weeks, 2 treatments a week. For each patient, a different number of impulses per session was delivered, depending on wound size (300 impulses + 100 impulses per cm2 wound-surface), at an energy flux density of 0.15 mJ/mm2 and a frequency of 5 pulses/s.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- chronic post-traumatic, venous, arterial, diabetic, or mixed wound of the lower limb
- wound persisting for longer than three months
- a wound surface bigger than 0,5 cm2
- a wound diameter between 0.5 and 5 cm
- unresponsiveness to conservative treatments and advanced wound managements in the 3 months prior to enrollment
- no changes in wound managements during the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- an ankle brachial index (ABPI)<0.7 and TcPO2<40 mmHg
- arrhythmias, presence of pacemaker, or coagulation disorders
- use of anticoagulant drugs
- neoplasia
- pregnancy
- soft tissue wound infections and/or osteomyelitis
- patients with full-thickness loss of soft tissue and extension into muscle, bone, tendon, or joint capsule.
